title: BBC Local Live: Nottinghamshire on Tuesday 10 January 2017 - BBC News
summary: nhs boss peter homa to retire later this year .
cash for hector the shar-pei 's operation raised .
police investigate after heron shot dead .
bird flu fear swans died over christmas period .
uncertainty over notts county and forest sales .
news , sport , travel and weather resume at 08:00 wednesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all for local live today .
join us again tomorrow .

documents.title: efl cup : stags play oldham
text: mansfield town face league one oldham athletic tonight in the last 16 of the efl trophy .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: bird flu restrictions make for 'grumpy ' hens
text: as reports of a potential bird flu outbreak comes to clumber park , a free-range chicken farm is coping keeping its birds indoors .
if the post-mortem tests on the swans reveal that the h5n8 strain of the virus caused their deaths , it 'll be the first case in nottinghamshire .
at trinity farm in cossall they 've built two large enclosures big enough so their hens can still be classed as free range .
daniel winter says the birds are feeling `` grumpy '' in their new home .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: crowds turn out for bramcote funeral of indian ww2 vet
text: more than 100 people lined the streets to bid farewell to one of the last indian army veterans who fought alongside the british in the second world war .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: eastleigh sign striker henderson
text: eastleigh sign striker henderson

documents.title: weather : wind warning
text: yellow warning for wind across nottinghamshire from the early hours till 11:00 tomorrow .
there could be gusts of 60-75mph .
author: Kay Crewdson
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: weather : chance of odd shower
text: increasingly cloudy skies to end the day today and , although most will stay dry , there 's the small chance of an odd shower for some .
gentle to moderate westerly winds and highs of 9c ( 48f ) .
author: Kay Crewdson
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: health visitor jobs threat 'receding '
text: the unite union has said the threat to axe up to 60 health visitor jobs across nottinghamshire `` appears to be receding '' .

a meeting 's been held with the nottinghamshire healthcare nhs foundation trust about the delivery of a new model of working but the organisation said it 'll be monitoring the situation `` very closely '' over the weeks and months ahead .
author: Peter Saull
BBC Radio Nottingham Political Reporter

documents.title: new role for ukip mep
text: ukip has named east midlands mep margot parker as `` spokesman '' for women & equalities
author: Tim Parker
BBC Radio Leicester Political Reporter

documents.title: crash death man 'a doting son '
text: the family , who nottinghamshire police said were `` utterly bereft '' , added that mr harris was a `` very caring and doting son '' .
`` since his father died three years ago , he had greatly supported and helped his mother , '' they said .
the statement also said the software engineer was an animal lover , a great outdoors enthusiast who had travelled the world .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tributes to christmas eve crash death man
text: police have released a statement from the family of a man who died after being hit by a lorry on the a57 in nottinghamshire on christmas eve .
dave harris , 33 , from ragnall , died after he was struck at about 03:40 in dunham-on-trent .
his mum anne harris and fiance alex postolowsky said he was `` popular , adored , selfless , kind and generous '' .
`` he was open-minded , hard-working and a tolerant individual who had a thirst for knowledge , particularly on world affairs , '' they said .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bus pass elvis reflects on decades in politics
text: big revelation from clifton 's bus pass elvis in this interview : `` i 've been shot by an airgun in the back . ''
we 'll be sad to see him go .
`` i was fed up sitting in the pub moaning about all what was going on all the sleaze and cash for questions '' @ twitterid
author: The Daily Politics

documents.title: pensioner left 'extremely upset and distressed '
text: call 101 if you have information .
the two men ran from her home leaving her extremely upset and distressed .
whilst shaken at the time she is now being comforted by her family .
the men had collected some of her items in her living room but left them behind in their rush to leave . ''
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: purse stolen from sleeping woman , 95
text: just awful - a 95-year-old woman woke to find two men in her bedroom searching her drawers and cupboards .
it happened at about 05:00 last wednesday in birding street , mansfield , police said .
they took her cream-coloured purse containing about £ 100 .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police confirm heron death
text: leicestershire police confirmed it had received a report that a bird had been shot this morning between 07:30 and 08:00 .
a spokeswoman said officers will be making enquiries .
john said it was an `` upsetting '' thing to see .

`` believe it or not , i am happy with legal shooting but this , when you 're walking down the high street and a heron drops beside you , it 's disturbing and gives legal shooting a bad name , '' he said .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'illegal to shoot a heron '
text: john retrieved the bird 's body and confronted the man and has since reported what happened to the police and the rspb .
`` it 's illegal to shoot a heron , '' he explained .
`` you can get a special licence like in a fishery , but all birds are protected under the wildlife and countryside act .
game birds come in a separate category . ''
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: heron shot and tossed in river
text: radio nottingham 's gardening expert , john stirland , called this morning to report a shocking wildlife crime he witnessed .
a man appeared to shoot a heron dead and throw its body in the river devon in muston , just over the leicestershire border , early this morning , he said .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : a611 crash
text: there 's slow traffic on a611 hucknall road near the top valley way junction because of an accident .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: park remains open after swan deaths
text: as a precautionary measure , national trust rangers informed government scientists , who removed the swan carcasses this week .
a post-mortem examination is currently being carried out .
clumber park will remain open to visitors as usual .
public health england advises that the risks to public health from the h5n8 virus are very low . ''
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bird flu fear swans died over christmas
text: yesterday i told you about the bodies of 12 swans found in clumber park that have been sent off for testing over bird flu fears .
today the national trust , which owns the park , have told me the swans were discovered near the lake on christmas eve .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hector settling in to new home
text: hector , who was found in bradford , was in danger of being put down when was taken in by halfway home .
mrs hosegood said hector is doing very well after his operation and settling in well in his new home .
`` his eyes are now open , he can blink - the whole attitude of hector changed , '' she said .
`` to see him play and actually a toy up huge thanks to everyone who donated towards hector . ''
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'saggy dog tail ' has happy ending
text: some great news now .
remember poor hector the shar-pei ?
well , the £ 1,500 he needed to remove his floppy folds of skin that were threatening his sight has been raised !
and he 's not only getting a facelift , he 's also got a new home , according to val hosegood , from halfway home dog rescue in collingham .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your miserable motorway
text: a grey day , illustrated perfectly by this photo from the m1 bridge between trowell services and junction 26 this morning .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: travel : a1 lane closed
text: one lane of the a1 northbound is closed between the a614 and the m18 because of a broken down vehicle .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: medical director also retiring
text: it 's also been announced that nuh 's medical director , dr steven fowlie , is to retire in may .
an nuh spokesman said recruitment for peter and stephen 's successors will start `` in the near future '' .
`` we are confident that nuh will attract exceptionally experienced and talented successors to peter and stephen , '' a statement on the trust 's website said .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nhs boss 'to spend time with family '
text: it has been a privilege and pleasure to serve nuh as chief executive for 10 years and the nhs for 27 years as a chief executive .

i will always treasure the long-lasting friendships and relationships developed with patients , relatives , staff and partners , as well as the accomplishments and challenges experienced during my career .
my passion for work has so often resulted in time being deflected away from my family .
retirement enables me to address this . ''
after 10 memorable years as nuh 's ceo and 27 years as a ceo , today i have announced my plan to retire in 2017
thank you @ twitterid
wishing you a very happy and relaxing retirement .
what a successor career you 've had , nuh has thrived under your leadership .
thank you kerry .
i hope you are well ?
@ twitterid
health and happiness peter on your new career my very best wishes
thank you steph .
i hope you are enjoying your new role ( now not so new ! )
@ twitterid
thank you for being such an inspirational leader @ twitterid you will be sorely missed , but enjoy your retirement .
morning alison .
very many thanks @ twitterid
have a wonderful , fulfilled & fun retirement .
i worked with you in leicester and you are an inspirational leader .
many thanks ruth .
best wishes .
peter @ twitterid
what a huge loss to the nhs peter !
thanks for being such an inspiring role model !
privileged to have had chance to work with you !
thanks for your kind words nicola .
best wishes @ twitterid
you are very welcome !
thank you for being our fabulous leader !
you 've inspired so many and you will be missed .
still ca n't quite believe you 're going
i will miss nuh and colleagues who make up 'teamnuh ' .
thank you rachel @ twitterid
you have been a superb # nhs leader who has stood the test of time and touched the lives of so many .
privilege to work with you .
morning dan .
thank you .
it has been a privilege to serve nuh as chief executive and work alongside colleagues such as yourself @ twitterid
you have been a supportive leader for all members of staff .
thank you for your support personally and of the junior doctors
thanks caroline .
i 'm pleased we have made such good progress , improving how we listen to and communicate with our trainees @ twitterid
i 'm hopeful the excellent work you started e.g .
trainee suppers will continue ; such a good insight for the # juniordoctors

text: # m1 n/b within j24 @ twitterid moved vehicle to hardshoulder .
all lanes now open thanks for your patience .
delays will take time to clear
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: city council car slapped with fine
text: oops !
looks like someone from nottingham city council may have a fine to pay .
the car was parked on double yellow lines this morning on station street , just yards from loxley house .
author: Kevin Stanley
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: nottingham forest sale 'on track '
text: for forest fans asking about the takeover , i understand `` there is no snag and it is on track . ''
both sides are working hard to get the deal done as soon as possible .
author: Natalie Jackson
BBC East Midlands sports editor

text: an accident is partially blocking the a52 inbound at the gamston island .
author: BBC Travel

here 's the view from junction 23a after an overturned vehicle has closed the m1 northbound at junction 24 .

documents.title: retirement news amid a & e black alert
text: the news about mr homa 's retirement has come as health bosses at the trust said today they had no choice but to declare a second black alert in the space of a week .
there 's been further huge demand at queen 's medical centre 's a & e department , prompting staff to urge patients not to attend unless it 's a genuine emergency .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingconfirmed : nhs chief exec peter homa to retire
text: nottingham nhs chief executive peter homa will retire later this year , the trust has confirmed .
mr homa , who 's chief executive of nottingham 's two main hospitals , has been in charge of the trust for a decade .
nottingham university hospitals trust has said it 'll release more details later this morning .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nottingham nhs boss peter homa 'stepping down '
text: that 's according to the health service journal
exclusive : one of england 's top chief executives to step down
peter homa consistently spoken highly of by staff who tell me he 's a good man with patient care at forefront of his mind .
sad loss for nhs .
for example took very little effort to source these messages from staff this morning :
three years as health correspondent in notts so i can really echo this .
he leaves a big hole .
felt like safe hands in a storm
only ever heard positive things about peter , including from former colleagues who work with him .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : m1 overturned vehicle
text: 1 lanes closed due to an overturned vehicle # m1 northbound within j24 nr # derby .
please allow extra travel time , delays expected .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: rock city co-founder dies
text: the co-founder of legendary nottingham music venue rock city has died following a long illness .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: watch : woman hits bus passenger with metal dog chain
text: this shocking footage shows a woman on bus in bobbers mill grabbing a female passenger by the throat before hitting her in the face with a metal dog chain wrapped around her fist .
it happened on the number 77 bus in alfreton road , near the gregory boulevard junction on 16 november , police said .
the passenger suffered a cut above her left eyebrow .
police are looking for anyone who recognises the woman to get in touch .
warning : third party content below , may contain ads .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

text: here 's how it 's looking today
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
text: top stories this morning :
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : a38 delays
text: slow traffic on a38 eastbound in pinxton because of an earlier broken down vehicle .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: four in ten patients faced four-hour wait last week
text: last week , nottingham university hospitals nhs trust declared a black alert following an incredibly busy festive period .
the qmc saw record numbers of patients waiting in a & e and on 2 january , four out of ten people had to wait over four hours to be seen .
yesterday , the trust declared another black alert and said that the pressure on services has been unrelenting since the start of the new year and long waits remain in the emergency department .
they 're calling on people to help by visiting pharmacies for minor illnesses or calling 111 to help relieve the pressure .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: qmc on black alert for second time in a week
text: the country 's `` broken '' a & e departments are all over the headlines this morning .
today nottingham 's hospitals have declared a black alert for the second time in the space of a week , with patients facing excessively long waits in the emergency department .
the local nhs trust is urging you to use alternatives , unless you have serious , life-threatening conditions .
more on this throughout the morning .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: forest 's american takeover looking uncertain
text: of course today was the day penciled in by prospective american owner of nottingham forest , john jay moores , to complete his takeover across the other side of the trent .
that too is now looking somewhat unlikely with the latest mumblings from across the atlantic being that moores is optimistic to close the deal soon but that nothing is definitive '' .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Radio Nottingham sports reporter

documents.title: magpies sale delayed by £ 1m loan
text: future ownership of notts county remains uncertain this morning after it emerged that the sticking point which is holding up alan hardy 's purchase of the club centres on a £ 1m loan which the club arranged some while ago with trustees of the haydn green estate .
the issue that 's come to light late in the day is with regard to repayment of the loan .
lawyers for hardy and ray trew , the outgoing chairman , spent most of yesterday trying to find a solution , but without success .
at least for the time being the two parties have reached an impasse .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Radio Nottingham sports reporter

documents.title: travel : a6097 delays
text: roadworks are causing slow traffic on the a6097 southbound between a612 in lowdham and the a46 junction in bingham .
author: BBC Travel
